{{ Infobox national basketball team| color1=ff7f00| color2=FFFFFF| country=Wales {{flagicon|Wales}}| logo= Wales_BBall.jpg| logo_width=120px| fiba_ranking=T-75th| joined_fiba=1956| fiba_zone=FIBA Europe| national_fed=[[Basketball Wales]]| coach=Steve Williams | h_body = ff7f00 | h_pattern_b = _basketballblankborder |h_shorts=FFFFFF |h_pattern_s= | a_body = ff7f00 | a_pattern_b = _basketballwhiteborder |a_shorts=ff7f00 |a_pattern_s=| oly_appearances=Not eligible to compete| wc_appearances=None| zone_championship=[[Eurobasket]]| zone_appearances=None }} The '''Welsh national basketball team''' is the [[basketball]] side that represents [[Wales]] in international competition. They are organised by [[Basketball Wales]], the sport's governing body in Wales. In 2005 Wales, along with [[England Basketball]] and [[basketballscotland]] combined forces to form the [[Great Britain national basketball team]], with the target goal to field a competitive team capable of winning medals at the [[London 2012]] [[summer Olympics]]. ==International Appearances== Wales has yet to appear in a major international basketball event. Currently, Wales is set in [[FIBA Europe]]'s Division C.
